section.heading: Definitions.
section.text: *NOTE: This codification is not the most current. To see the current law, click this link Current Version*
For the purposes of this subchapter, the term:

para.text: “Central Collection Unit” means the Central Collection Unit established within the Office of Finance and Treasury of the Office of the Chief Financial Officer to implement this subchapter.
Any financial obligation owed by a person to a District agency that remains unpaid more than 90 days after it was due; provided, that the term shall not include tax debts or child-support debts; or

A fine issued by the Alcoholic Beverage and Cannabis Administration pursuant to section 9 of the Legalization of Marijuana for Medical Treatment Initiative of 1999, effective July 27, 2010 (D.C. Law 18-210; D.C. Official Code § 7-1671.08), or section 8 of the Medical Cannabis Amendment Act of 2022, effective March 22, 2023 (D.C. Law 24-332; D.C. Official Code § 7-1675.01), that remains unpaid more than 30 days after it was due.
“Delinquent Debt Fund” or “Fund” means the Delinquent Debt Fund established by § 1-350.04.
“District agency” means any District office, department, or agency, including independent agencies, but not including the District of Columbia Water and Sewer Authority.
“Person” means any natural person, trust, corporation, limited liability corporation, partnership, limited liability partnership, or any other business organization.

annotations.annotation: For temporary addition of subchapter, see §§ 1042-1053 of the Fiscal Year 2013 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 2012 (D.C. Act 19-413, July 25, 2012, 59 DCR 9290).
